Based on your preferences, I would highly recommend "Alex in Wonderland" (1996) directed by Angelo Rossitto and starring Jeanne Moreau, Paul Mazursky, and Ellen Burstyn.

The movie follows the life of Alex Morrison, played by John Cusack, who after surviving a domestic violence attack becomes determined to use his skills as an actor to help others who have been victims of bullying and abuse just like her.
Alex' mission is to empower, inspire and train women and children so they too can stand up for themselves against bullying.
Among her students is 13- year- old Logan Chauvin. Logan was terrorized daily in school by callous bullies. He has been training vigorously with Alex to overcome his experience and is now getting ready for his first real MMA fight.
Although Alex has done everything in her power to train Logan to stand up to bullies at school, there is very little she can do to protect him from his first real MMA opponent.
Overall, "Alex in Wonderland" is a heartwarming and inspiring movie that will leave you feeling uplifted and inspired.
